title: 110_s1730
content: The "Pathways to Independence Act of 2007" authorizes a modified employability plan for individuals with disabilities. The "Pathways to Independence Act of 2007" allows for a modified employability plan for individuals with disabilities, enabling them to meet work participation requirements. The "Pathways to Independence Act of 2007" allows for a modified employability plan for individuals with disabilities, determining necessary work activity modifications. The modified employability plan under the "Pathways to Independence Act of 2007" specifies the required participation hours, services, supports, and modifications for recipients, developed in cooperation with the recipient and reviewed every 6 months. The modified employability plan under the "Pathways to Independence Act of 2007" specifies required participation hours and activities for recipients to be deemed engaged in work for a month in a fiscal year. The State must meet requirements and comply with reporting for TANF recipients participating in work activities under a modified employability plan. The State must report the aggregate number and percentage of TANF recipients with modified employability plans due to disability who substantially complied with work activities. The State reported on TANF recipients with modified employability plans due to disability who complied with work activities and provided information on prevalent types of impairments. The State reported on TANF recipients with modified employability plans due to disability, including prevalent types of modifications in work activities and qualifications of staff determining disability. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress on State efforts to promote employment for individuals with disabilities in TANF programs. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress on State efforts to engage individuals with disabilities in work activities. The report should include the number of individuals with modified employability plans and the types of impairments leading to disability determination. The annual report to Congress must include details on individuals with disabilities, such as the types of modifications in employability plans and their participation in work activities. The annual report to Congress must include an analysis of the extent to which modified employability plans affected States' achievement of minimum participation rates for individuals with disabilities. The curr_chunk discusses how certain conditions or addictions can hinder employment or limit major life activities. It also defines "modified work activities" as tasks that help recipients become employable without affecting limitations or requirements. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on October 1, 2007. SEC. 3. STATE OPTION TO EXCLUDE SSI APPLICANTS IN WORK PARTICIPATION RATE. Section 407(b)(5) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow states the option to not require single custodial parents caring for a child under 12 months to work, and to disregard individuals receiving certain benefits when calculating participation rates. Under Title II, a State can provide benefits if an application has been filed, there is a reasonable basis for disability or blindness, no final denial decision has been made, and the application status is reviewed every 6 months. Under Title II, a State reviews the status of an application to determine if the individual still meets disability criteria. The State can disregard an individual's disability status on a case-by-case basis if they would qualify for benefits but for the requirement of a 12-month continuous disability. The effective date for these amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section will be effective on October 1, 2007.
